newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Mosenergo Q1 Russian net profit 0.85 trln rbls.
newsitem.headline: Mosenergo Q1 Russian net profit 0.85 trln rbls.

text.p: Notes: To Russian accounting standards on a cash basis.

A Mosenergo official said sales to the federal wholesale electricity market declined to 3.2 billion kilowatt hours, accounting for the decrease in Mosenergo electricity output. The official did not give a comparative figure.
Heating output was lower due to average higher temperatures in Moscow over the first quarter in 1997 compared to 1996.

These figures are not prepared to international accounting standards but to Russian accounting standards, which differ significantly from those normally supplied in the West. Russian accounts are designed to meet the requirements of the tax authorities. Russian companies can choose whether to show revenues and spending on a cash or accruals basis. Definitions of profit and assets differ significantly from those in the West, and converting Russian accounts to international standards can turn a profit into a loss.
Figures are not adjusted for inflation or the depreciation of the rouble, but the following data may be helpful.
Dollar on Moscow Interbank Currency Exchange (MICEX):
Year-on-year consumer price inflation rate in December 1996 was 21.8 percent in December 1996 after 131 percent in December 1995 and 215 percent in December 1994.
